column4: hello, i've upgraded to karmic and i'm having a variety of problems with pulseaudio, perhaps someone can help?
my old setup: a laptop with intrepid and a server running jaunty
all audio was passed to the jaunty server to be played out through the speakers
it doesnt seem to be every time i play audio
definitely when i use audio from firefox/flash
other times at random it seems
also whenever i play audio, local pulseaudio uses 99% CPU
don't remove pulseaudio just yet
pulseaudi may need reconfiguring if you have a complex setup its changed a bit.. but still only works for some people :/
i have tried the various configuration applets etc but haven't got anywhere with them - any recommendations of where to go from here?
you say you are streaming audio over hte net?
local network, yes
you have same pulseaudio version on both ends?
no but i don't think i had the same version previously
but the newer version in karmic might well be incompatible with the other end
hmm that's true
though, it's not every case that causes problems - some are fine
I'd still try with streaming to another instance of the same version and see if it helps
i've tried playing from spotify (wine/alsa plugin) and it's fine; totem is fine; anything with firefox/flash just crashes pulseaudio on the other end
they probably use some features that the remote end doesn't support
I'd try with the same verison on the other end
ok, what's the best way of going about that? are there packages for jaunty for 0.9.19?
or packages for karmic for 0.9.14?
I don't think so.. definitely not the 2nd one because karmic uses features that aren't in the old pulseaudio
